The body of the victim, who is being treated for a fractured skull and fractures to her neck and shoulders, has been found at the scene.
She is described as being in her 40s.
A short time later, her head was found.
Mrs Corria, who could not be named for legal reasons, is described as being in her late 20s and working full-time in the local community.
She was last seen on July 8, 2016, by her daughter.
Her body was found two days later.
Her death has been ruled a homicide and her son, Jason Corria, was treated at a Royal London Hospital.
The cause of death has not been confirmed by the coroner.
Mrs Corria's husband, Richard Corria, said: "We are so devastated at how this tragedy has unfolded. We are very, very sad and we are devastated.
She has been a loving, caring mother of two young children and as a mother I would ask her to let us know what her life is like, where she is from and what her future plans are.

Gavin Corria, who has been with Mrs Corria since the family first met and remembers her as a "very special, beautiful, loving mother", said: "It goes without saying that when I saw the body, I knew it was my daughter.
She was a very beautiful, wonderful woman, always smiling and always smiling.
